string-array.name: defs
string-array.item: The command, which stands for "Android Debug Bridge", is a command line tool which allows the programmer to send instructions from the computer he or she is using to the emulated Android device on that computer.
A debugging tool that comes with Lint Mint.
By typing this command at the command line, one can access Android package manager.

One can find useful inforamtion about emulators installed on a computer by typing "emulator --help" at command line. An Android emulator imitates the actual operations of a mobile device on a computer.
By typing this command at the command line, one can take a snap shot of an Android device display and the snap shot is saved automatically as png image file onto the local computer.
By typing this command at the command line, one can get information about Gradle software, such as version and help.
Within the "main" directory: there are one xml file, and two sub-directories. The name of the xml is AndroidManifest.

One of the two sub-dirctories is called "java", which also includes one sub-directory called "org".Within "org", it also contains one sub-directory called "hello", within which contains a java file called "HelloActivity.java".

The other sub-directory under "main" is "res". "res" has two sub-directories called "layout" and "values".Within each of these two directories, each has an xml file. "layout" contains "hello_layout.xml" while "values" contains "strings.xml".
